briefdescription.para: Internal array storing matrix components.

detaileddescription.para: Components are stored in column-major order, that is, each 4 subsequent elements represent a matrix column.

briefdescription.para: Internal array storing the vector components.
Internal array storing the vector components.
Internal array storing the vector components.
Default constructor. Initializes all components to 0.
Creates a diagonal matrix. The diagonal components are initialized with the value f.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar value for the diagonal components.

briefdescription.para: Creates a diagonal matrix with the components of vec3<T> as the diagonal elements. Element at [4, 4] is set to 1.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar value for the diagonal components.

memberdef.argsstring: (const T f0_0, const T f1_0, const T f2_0, const T f3_0, const T f0_1, const T f1_1, const T f2_1, const T f3_1, const T f0_2, const T f1_2, const T f2_2, const T f3_2, const T f0_3, const T f1_3, const T f2_3, const T f3_3)
memberdef.name: mat4

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new `mat4` with all 16 components explicitly specified. The values are stored in column major order, that is, the first 4 arguments represent the first column, and so on.

parameterdescription.para: (i==row, j == col)

briefdescription.para: Convenient method to construct a 4x4 identity matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type of the matrix components.

simplesect.para: A new mat4<T>-identity matrix-

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t row, const size_t col) const
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Provides read-only access to a matrix component. Elements are accessed in column major order: `m[row + col * 4]`. Bounds checking is performed via `assert` in debug builds.

parameterdescription.para: The zero based row index.
The zero based col index.

simplesect.para: A const ref to the component at the specified position.

briefdescription.para: Provides read-write access to a matrix component. Elements are accessed in column major order: `m[row + col * 4]`. Bounds checking is performed via `assert` in debug builds.

parameterdescription.para: The zero based row index.
The zero based col index.

simplesect.para: A ref to the component at the specified position.

briefdescription.para: Compares this matrix element's with the rgt matrix considering an epsilon value. Returns true if for all elements the equation |a-b| <= EPSILON holds.

parameterdescription.para: The other matix to compare with this matrix for equality.

simplesect.para: True is the elements of the matrices are considered equal, otherwise false.

xrefdescription.para: account for abs (values close to zero) and rel (larger values), move EPSILON to global constant

briefdescription.para: Strictly compares the elements of this matrix with the elements of the rgt matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The right matrix to compare for equal values

simplesect.para: Trie if all elements are equal (==), false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Performs matrix-multiplication with another `mat4`. This matrix is the left operand, while `m` is the right operand.

parameterdescription.para: The right-hand side `mat4<T>` for multiplication.

simplesect.para: A new `mat4<T>`, representing the result of the matrix-multiplication.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const pointer to the first element of the matrix's components.

detaileddescription.para: Useful for APIs that expect a pointer to matrix data, like OpenGL.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type of the matrix components.
A reference to the `mat4<T>` matrix.

simplesect.para: A const pointer to the element at [0, 0].

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the first element of the matrix's components.

detaileddescription.para: Useful for APIs that expect a pointer to matrix data, like OpenGL.

parameterdescription.para: The numeric type of the matrix components.
A reference to the `mat4<T>` matrix.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the element at [0, 0].

briefdescription.para: Creates a new vec2 with its values initialized to (0, 0).

briefdescription.para: Vector and matrix type definitions.

detaileddescription.para: This module provides fundamental mathematical types including 2D, 3D, and 4D vectors, as well as 4x4 matrices used for graphics transformations and spatial computations.
